section.title: Automating Installations
section.para: CentOS Studio can save you time and labor by helping you automate the client boot-up and kickstart process.

section.title: Kickstarting Client Machines
section.para: Kickstart files let you automate system installations by providing answers to install-time questions such as selection of language, network configuration, keyboard, file system configuration, mouse, timezone and root password.
To include a kickstart file in your samba-server.definition, use the kickstart element, as in the example below. Substitute your own kickstart filename for ks.cfg.
See the SDFR for the kickstart element syntax.

section.title: Modifying boot.iso and diskboot.img network installation images
section.para: To add custom kernel boot arguments to the /isolinux/isolinux.cfg file of the boot.iso image, use the bootiso element in your solution definition. Substitute your appropriate IP addresses.

informalexample.programlisting: <publish> <boot-options"> keymap=us lang=en_US ip=192.168.0.222 netmask=255.255.255.0 gateway=192.168.0.2 dns=192.168.0.7 </boot-options> </publish>

section.para: See the SDFR for the complete syntaxes of the publish element.
